questions.text: Who got the Employee of the Month Award?
questions.explanation:
Woody.

	Sam actually one it first but he didn't want it. Then Carla won it, but she didn't want it either. Rebecca then gave the award to Woody. He said this was the 4th month in a row he had one. He was very excited about winning.

questions.text: How many times did Carla say Sam had come on to Rebecca?
questions.explanation:
4,659.

	Sam said he didn't know how many times he'd come onto Rebecca so Carla answered him. Sam was about to give up on Rebecca at that point.

questions.text: Who did Cliff need to train?
questions.explanation:
Margaret O'Keefe.

	Margaret O'Keefe (aka Maggie) was played by Annie Golden. In 1979 she played Jeannie Ryan in the musical movie "Hair".

questions.text: How much did the trainee say she loved the post office?
options: more than any other job she's had in the past
questions.explanation:
more than life itself.

	Carla is sickened by this news and wondered if all the postal workers were the same. Cliff is proud of Maggie and decided that perhaps she would be a good postal carrier (at first he told her that women "didn't belong in the trenches").

questions.text: What did Rebecca say "turned her knees to butter"?
questions.explanation:
a song.

	She said she told Sam "because you'll never get it, and I mean that in every sense of the word." Sam told Fraiser he was in luck because "how many songs could there be?".

questions.text: What song did Cliff say moved him?
questions.explanation:
Ballad of the Green Berets.

	"Ballad of the Green Berets" was written by Barry Sadler. Sadler was shot in the head and killed in 1988.  Cliff said that anyone who wasn't moved by that song he didn't want to know.  Some of the lyrics to the song are: "Back at home a young wife waitsHer Green Beret has met his fateHe has died for those oppressedLeaving her this last request Put silver wings on my son's chestMake him one of America's bestHe'll be a man they'll test one dayHave him win the Green Beret"

questions.text: What gift did Cliff get his trainee?
questions.explanation:
arch supports.

	He said he got the large size cause he noticed she had big feet. Cliff is not very good at being romantic.

questions.text: What felony did the trainee commit?
questions.correct: driving a U.S. postal truck without permission
options: leaving the scene of an accident
questions.explanation:
driving a U.S. postal truck without permission

	Cliff was very angry about this when he found out. But then with a little persuasion from Maggie he agreed to make up a story that someone stole the truck.

You've Lost that Lovin' Feeling.

	All of the songs mentioned were songs done by The Righteous Brothers. Sam called Rebecca's mother to find out her favorite song. He then played it for Rebecca but she resisted him. However, when Norm entered the office she kissed him. She then apologized and told Norm to tell Vera she apologized to which Norm replied, "Are you kidding after that Vera should apologize to me."

questions.text: Why did the trainee not find Cliff attractive anymore?
options: she hit her head and got amnesia
questions.explanation:
he lied, dishonoring the uniform.

	She told Cliff, "Even though I'm the one who corrupted you, you are corrupt." Cliff then decided to tell the truth so that Maggie would still be attracted to him.
